pr_title: Rename and refactor before major release

timeline.message:
Rename and refactor before major release

* Rename NotificationProcessingHandler to OSRemoteNotificationReceivedHandler
* Rename notificationProcessing to remoteNotificationReceived
* Rename NotificationOpenedHandler to OSNotificationOpenedHandler
* Rename OSNotificationOpenResult to OSNotificationOpenedResult
* Refactor notificationProcessing instead of receiving OSNotificationReceived receive OSNotificationReceivedEvent
* Refactor notificationWillShowInForeground instead of receiving AppNotificationGenerationJob receive OSNotificationReceivedEvent
* Create single source of true OSNotification
* Delete OSNotificationPayload, all data is now on OSNotification
* Create OSMutableNotification
* Delete AppNotificationGenerationJob

timeline.bodyText: Should be com.onesignal.NotificationServiceExtension, update example as well.
timeline.author: jkasten2

@@ -0,0 +1,186 @@

+package com.onesignal;
+
+import android.content.Context;
+
+import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
+import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
+import androidx.core.app.NotificationCompat;
+
+import org.json.JSONObject;
+
+import static com.onesignal.OSUtils.isStringEmpty;
+
+public class OSNotificationController {
+
+   // The extension service app AndroidManifest.xml meta data tag key name
+   private static final String EXTENSION_SERVICE_META_DATA_TAG_NAME = "com.onesignal.NotificationExtensionServiceClass";

timeline.bodyText:
This is passing isBackgroundLogic but the param name for processJobForDisplay is callForegroundLogic.
Seems like we are flipping the logic here when we should not? Or just one of the names wrong?
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText:
I think we just need to pass in notification here and remove the comment.
If we make a copy then the notification.setNotificationExtender they may have set would not work.
timeline.author: jkasten2

replies.bodyText:
the setNotificationExtender is being copied too, just wanted to avoid the possibility of the user of calling complete under the handler and then after complete, access the android id, or doing something else under the mutable notification
Example:
notificationEvent.complete(mutableNotification);
mutableNotification.setAndroidId(111)
replies.author: Jeasmine

replies.bodyText: ah gotcha, sorry I missed that, you are right
replies.author: jkasten2

timeline.bodyText: Rename class to AppRemoteNotificationServiceExtension to match the new NotificationServiceExtension naming.
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.message:
Add android Id mutate test and fix test due to service renaming

* Update Demo app remove additional data access under foreground handler
* Fix test fue to service renaming
* Add test for checking android Id is not being mutated after calling complete

Add android Id mutate test and fix test due to service renaming

* Update Demo app remove additional data access under foreground handler
* Fix test fue to service renaming
* Add test for checking android Id is not being mutated after calling complete
Rename demo app Service to NotificationServiceExtension

Add failing test for saving notification before complete finished

* Given that the code is running procedural if foreground handler doesnt call in the same thread complete, then code will continue running, and will end on saving notification before timer or user complete is runned.
* Display timeout is respected by saving notification is not.

Avoid continue logic when having foreground handler

* When having foreground handler active, stop processing notification, it will be processed by user or timer complete

Avoid continue logic when having foreground handler

* When having foreground handler active, stop processing notification, it will be processed by user or timer complete

Avoid continue logic when having foreground handler

* When having foreground handler active, stop processing notification, it will be processed by user or timer complete

timeline.bodyText: Remove payload, the properties below should be on the mainObj
timeline.author: jkasten2
jkasten2

timeline.message:
Fix testNotificationReceivedWhenAppInFocus failing test

* Test is failing for duplicate notification, if complete is not called then notification might not be saved at the time the notification arrive again. It is ok for beta 1, but will be fixed on the future

timeline.bodyText:
This comment is out of date. I suggest we replace it with this. /** * Implement this interface on a class with a default public constructor and provide class with namespace * as a value to a new `meta-data` tag with the key name of "com.onesignal.NotificationServiceExtension" in * your AndroidManifest.xml. * ex. *

* Allows for modification of a notification by calling {@link OSNotification#mutableCopy} * instance and passing it into {@link OSMutableNotification#setExtender(NotificationCompat.Extender)} * To display the notification, call {@link OSNotificationReceivedEvent#complete(OSNotification)} with a notification instance. * To omit displaying a notification call {@link OSNotificationReceivedEvent#complete(OSNotification)} with null. */
timeline.author: jkasten2
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -174,50 +138,49 @@ public boolean isAppClose() {
     * Naming can be whatever makes the most sense to the developer, but to actually activate any
     *    implemented interfaces, a metadata tag with a specific OneSignal key and then file path value
     *    must be added to the apps AndroidManifest.xml
-    *       ex. <meta-data android:name="com.onesignal.NotificationExtensionServiceClass" android:value="com.company.ExtensionService" />
+    *       ex. <meta-data android:name="com.onesignal.NotificationServiceExtension" android:value="com.company.ExtensionService" />

timeline.bodyText:
Follow up from this comment
#1156 (review)
This also should be renamed, as this callForegroundLogic ends up becoming fromBackgroundLogic in the processJobForDisplay(OSNotificationController notificationController, boolean opened, boolean fromBackgroundLogic) below
timeline.author: jkasten2

timeline.message:
Code cleaning

* Manifest service declaration is not needed anymore since we only depend on metadata
* Rename notificationID json key to notificationId
* Remove payload object from toJSONObject

* Manifest service declaration is not needed anymore since we only depend on metadata

* Remove payload object from toJSONObject
